question: A body is discovered in a park in Chicago in the middle of summer. It has a fractured skull and many other broken bones, but the cause of death was hypothermia.   How could this be
result: The body was that of a construction worker who fell from the scaffolding on the John Hancock Center and landed in a puddle of water. The cold water shock caused his body to go into shock and he died of hypothermia.

In the evening, he gets into the elevator, and, if there is someone else in the elevator -- or if it was raining that day -- he goes back to his floor directly. A man lets go of a bowling ball.  A short while later, he is rushed to the hospital.   How could this be
result: The man has a condition called ankylosing spondylitis, which fuses the vertebrae in his spine together.  When he lets go of the bowling ball, his spine is unable to absorb the shock, and he ruptures a disc in his spine.

question: Two men enter a bar.  They both order identical drinks.  One lives; the other dies.   How could this be
result: One man was poisoned while the other was not.

result: Craig's death was seen as more romantic, while Beulah's was seen as more mundane.

result: The man choked to death on his breakfast cereal.

question: A man lay dead in a field.   Next to him was a gun.  One shot had been fired and because of that shot the man had died.  Yet the man was not shot; in fact, there was no wound or mark on the body.   How could this be
result: The man committed suicide by shooting himself in the head.

question: Two brothers are involved in a murder.  Though it's clear that one of them actually committed the crime, neither can be punished.    (from "Unreasonable Doubt," by Stanley Ellin) How could this be
result: If the brothers have the same alibi, then neither of them can be convicted.
